p: Reunion Island is a hotspot of vegetal biodiversity where the use of medicinal plant-derived beverages is documented since the 17th century [ 1]. To date, 22 plants are referred to in the French Pharmacopeia; they are traditionally used by the population for their antioxidant, antidiabetic, hypolipidemic and anti-inflammatory properties. The commercialization of these plants (dry form) for infusion or decoction is based on empirical data, urging for the need to investigate the composition and antioxidant activity of these herbal preparations.
